DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Diagnostic procedure , contrast-enhanced MRI , may help find diagnose ductal carcinoma situ . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study contrast-enhanced MRI woman ductal breast carcinoma situ healthy volunteer .
DOC.brief_title: Contrast-Enhanced MRI Women With Ductal Breast Carcinoma Situ Healthy Volunteers
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To compare ductal carcinoma situ ( DCIS ) -optimized MRI standard clinical MRI , term conspicuity DCIS lesion , agreement disease extent biopsy , overall image quality ( i.e. , artifact level , uniformity fat suppression , contrast noise ratio signal noise ratio ) , woman DCIS breast . - To compare two DCIS-optimized MRIs variability enhancement level DCIS . - To examine effect menstrual cycle variability background enhancement level healthy volunteer . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients randomize 1 2 arm . - Arm I : Patients undergo standard clinical contrast-enhanced MRI approximately 30-45 minute . No 3 day later , patient undergo ductal carcinoma situ ( DCIS ) -optimized contrast-enhanced MRI . - Arm II : Patients undergo DCIS-optimized contrast-enhanced MRI approximately 30-45 minute . No 3 day later , patient undergo second DCIS-optimized contrast-enhanced MRI . Healthy volunteer undergo DCIS-optimized contrast-enhanced MRI arm II .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Meets 1 follow criterion : Patient University California , San Francisco Breast Care Center meeting follow criterion : Biopsy proven ductal carcinoma situ ( DCIS ) breast Has undergone mammography within past 60 day Healthy volunteer No prior breast disease PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Not pregnant nursing ( stop nurse within past 3 month ) Negative pregnancy test No contraindication MRI ( e.g. , implanted pacemaker , implant ferromagnetic device , ferromagnetic aneurysm clip , severe claustrophobia , ocular metal fragment , shrapnel injury ) PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : More 2 year since prior surgery ipsilateral breast ( patient ) No prior radiotherapy ipsilateral breast ( patient ) No prior cytotoxic regimen ( patient )
